headline: Monopoly maker Hasbro cuts 3% of total workforce amid higher tariff costs
summary: (Reuters) -Toy seller Hasbro  has cut 3% of its global workforce in its latest cost-cutting effort amid higher U.S. tariffs on toys from China.  "We are aligning our structure with our long-term goals," Hasbro spokesperson Abby Hodes told Reuters.  The toymaker has been speeding up efforts to diversify sourcing and reduce exposure to China.

"We are aligning our structure with our long-term goals," Hasbro spokesperson Abby Hodes told Reuters.  The toymaker has been speeding up efforts to diversify sourcing and reduce exposure to China.

headline: Hasbro Trims 3% of Workforce in Cost-Cutting Push
summary: It is the latest round of job cuts as part of a multi-year restructuring at the maker of Monopoly board games and Nerf blasters.
